sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

```
A --- B --- F          G
|     |                 |
C --- D --- E          H
```

Identify if there are any cut vertices and bridges in this graph.
message_2:
In the given undirected graph:

```
A --- B --- F          G
|     |                 |
C --- D --- E          H
```

A cut vertex is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. In this graph, the cut vertices are B and D. Removing B will disconnect A, C, and F from D and E, while removing D will disconnect A, B, and C from E.

A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. In this graph, there are two bridges: the edge between B and F, and the edge between D and E. Removing the edge between B and F will disconnect F from the rest of the graph, and removing the edge between D and E will disconnect E from the rest of the graph.

Note that G and H are isolated vertices and do not affect the identification of cut vertices and bridges in the connected component containing A, B, C, D, E, and F.
